Why? Is it possible to configure it to work well again (i.e., the way it worked before)?

Stiamo riscontrando in azieda dei problemi sul calendario. In Thunderbird mappiamo un nostro calendario di rete presente sul server di posta principale.

Fatti i seguenti test: 1) creazione evento su calendario della webmail del prodotto di posta. Scaricando il file ics appare così

title: Problema con lo scroll UP/Down della rotella su Thunderbird dopo l'ultimo aggiornamento
content:
Salve, prima dell'aggiornamento, ero abituato a utilizzare la rotella del mouse per scorrere le email nella mia casella di posta in modo molto comodo. Tuttavia, dopo l'ultimo aggiornamento di Thunderbird, questo comportamento è cambiato. 

Ora, quando provo a utilizzare la rotella del mouse per scorrere verso l'alto o verso il basso nella lista delle email o nel contenuto di un messaggio, non accade nulla. Devo effettuare lo scroll manualmente utilizzando la barra di scorrimento sul lato dell'applicazione, il che è scomodo e meno efficiente.

Ho verificato che il problema non sia legato al mio mouse o al driver del mouse, poiché lo scroll funziona correttamente in altre applicazioni e sul mio sistema operativo.

Chiedo gentilmente se potresti aiutarmi a risolvere questo problema o se hai conoscenza di una soluzione temporanea che potrei utilizzare mentre aspetto una correzione da parte del team di sviluppo di Thunderbird.
creator: lasersoft2019

creator: olivertringham

title: Dopo l'upgrade a Thunderbird Supernova non riesco ad abilitare la nuova visualizzazione
content:
Salve.

Premesso che ho ancora Windows 10, che però tengo sistematicamente aggiornato, ho appena eseguito l'upgrade di Thunderbird alla versione Supernova seguendo l'invito che mi è arrivato per email. La stessa email dà le prime istruzioni per configurare la visualizzazione nel nuovo modo, precisando che inizialmente resta impostata la vecchia modalità perchè l'utente potrebbe non voler cambiare subito. Io invece vorrei, ma non riesco, perchè se vado su Visualizza - Struttura tutte le opzioni sono ghostate salvo "Mostra il pannello Oggi" (vedi immagine). Mi è impossibile quindi adottare la nuova visualizzazione, come invece dicono le istruzioni nella email. Leggo poi da una risposta ad altro problema che la nuova versione non sarebbe indicata come upgrade, ma di questo nella email non c'era traccia, anzi, c'erano proprio le istruzioni da seguire per eseguire l'upgrade!

Grazie per l'aiuto.
creator: musicante-ritmico

title: Statuses of folders doesn't work
content:
Hi. I have a few problems with the newest version of thunderbird 115.3.0 (64bit), but I had the same problems with previous versions too.

When I get an email, the name of folder(s) become blue and bold, an orange star appears and the number of unread emails increases. But when I click something (doesn't matter what) or slide a scroll, the name of the folder becomes black as it was on the beginning and the orange star disappears. When I click the name of the folder it again is marked with an orange star.

Very often I don't receive email, but I should. I press "Get Messages" button, I see "no new messages" at the bottom of the window. I repeat it a few times and every time the result is the same. After 30 seconds or few minutes Thunderbird starts receiving messages from the last 2 hours.

We noticed very similar behaviour on a several computers. I was tested also in safe-mode and everything looks the same.

title: Thunderbird Message URI's changed / Lost previously opened Tabs
content:
So, I opened Thunderbird to a ton of new emails (1000+ being downloaded, I was away for a few weeks).

Mid-way through, Windows crashed, when I restarted the 50+ tabs I had open previously would not restore. I've tried the session.json delete etc, no luck.

However, I kept a copy of the old session.json and found 3-4 of the messages I used to have open. But the message URI's are completed different. The Inbox URI for one message used to be in the 97,000's and is now just over 24,000, likewise for messages from the Junk Folder.

I believe this is why the messages aren't opening, they are looking for URI's that no-longer exist (tried command-line opening and likewise no luck).

Is there any explanation as to why the URI's would suddenly change like that and/or how to work out the relationship between the old and new URI's?

Coupled with this, a number of emails I remembered from my tabs, when searched for, show up in the search window, but when I try to open them from the search results I get nothing, albeit the email itself is still physically present if I scroll to it's position and open it in the Inbox.

Any ideas?

Such messages are also reformatted after they are sent. I see the reformatted version if there is a reply quoting my message. It's like they have been made to fit less columns and look amateurish if you get my meaning : (

I hate the dashed border. It's ugly as hell and an unnecessary annoyance. I'd like to get rid of it and also prevent the appearance of messages getting changed please.
creator: Jay.Dear

title: Don't know purpose of "All Mail" folder
content: I am using Thunderbird Supernova. I have ten email accounts in it. Each one has an "all mail" folder as shown in the attachment. Do I need these folders or can I delete them?
creator: mrtownley1

title: Is there a way to use the fields of the email index in a search query?
content:
I keep on hitting the search limitations. I am an IT pro and I know how it works. But it seems there is no UI to access that level of detail.

I try to use open source as much as I can. So on my private PC I use Thunderbird instead of Outlook which is on my work PC. But my case is very peculiar, I collected 12 email addresses over many years around the globe. And searching in this mess is the challenge!

So not being able to name the fields in the search query severely limits the possibility to find things in the 14 year backlog over 12 email accounts ;)

I am worried that fixing this might go too deep under the hood to be a reasonable feature request for this project.

Any ideas?

Because Outlook is not much fun either :(
creator: dr.uv

title: MAIN   EMAIL   PAGE   JUMPING
content: I HAVE JUST USED THE LATEST THUNDERBIRD UPDATE BUT NOW WHEN I DO THE SMALLEST THING LIKE CHANGING THE COLOUR OF ONE EMAIL FROM BLACK TO RED IT JUST JUMPS TO ANOTHER EMAIL PAGE  ; HOW DO I STOP THAT .
creator: RUNT66661

title: Show recipient in card view
content: The supernova update is really nice, but I couldn't figure out how to show recipients in card view (in table view I just check "recipient" and it shows up as a column). My use case is that I want to easily tell which account (inbox) is associated with each email when using a unified inbox folder.
creator: helium6072

title: Each update causes problems
content:
It seems with recent updates, things no longer work as it used to. I am currently using 115.3.0, build ID 20230926115257 on Debian Linux.

It used to be that if you selected the view as "Unread", it would stick with that folder, now it just does it until you leave the folder.

I normally view messages as text since html can be a security issue. There is a button marked "Show HTML", which no longer works. Now I have to select "View", "Message Body as" and then manually select things back and forth.

I used to be able to have a button for the Filter Function to have filter folder or filter message, not it is only a selection for Filter Functions and then I can select what I want to do. This is going backwards.

Under "Unread Folders", often the count is incorrect and it claims that there is a message which is unread, which is false. If I select "Compact View", and then unselect it, the count gets corrected.

There are also other issues which were caused by updates. There is clearly an issue with regards with a lack of testing to ensure things are not getting broken.
creator: k+firefoxzz

title: New Account in Thunderbird
content: I am trying to re-establish one of my email accounts in Thunderbird using a new OS (fresh install for both OS and Thunderbird). Auto settings work just fine until it gets to verifying my password where it fails. This is a password that was used for a previous account in Thunderbird on my previous OS where it worked without issue. I can go to my provider and log in using this password without issue. I have not yet tried changing the password as I can't rationalize why that should matter. Actually, I logged onto this site using that password. So, I know it works.
creator: bilyo41

title: Cannot get new messages but everything else is working
content: One of my two TB email accounts has been stuck on 'check messages' for two days with a constantly spinning wheel. I cannot download new messages (although I can get them on my non-synced phone). The account will let me send messages, and there is no problem with the other email account. How do I fix this?
creator: signaturepublishing

title: Reverse Migration
content:
I was using 68.0. Mail merge (Andreas Bergmann) quit working.

I upgrade to 115.0. Mailmerge does not pick up pdf attachments correctly.

How can I revert back to 68.0 or slightly earlier, to restore full mail merge functionality. And all my old email. (Yes I have backups...)

It appears that thunderbird has created some format changes that make it difficult to revert, (and on a personal note, the new UI is horrible, who dreams up forever moving box/buttons around?)
creator: rdesalis

title: Gmail OAuth fails
content:
I've had the same setup of my gmail accounts for years in Thunderbird, but today one of them stopped working.

Whenever I try to get or send mail, I get the pop-up OAuth window for logging into Google. I do so successfully and select "allow" to give access to Thunderbird. But then, back in Thunderbird, I see "Host contacted, sending login information..." and it never finishes. Eventually (many minutes) it times out. I have tried dozens of times with the same result.

I have a second gmail account configured in the same instance of Thunderbird, with exactly the same settings. It continues to work fine, and does not display the OAuth pop-up when I get/send mail. This makes me think that the problem has something to do with my Google account rather than with my Thunderbird settings, but I have not changed anything there either.

Both accounts are configured for pop3 (pop.gmail.com:995), security SSL/TLS, authentication OAuth2. Thunderbird is set to accept all cookies and keep until expired. I deleted all saved passwords for the failing account, but Thunderbird still has the password for the account that is working.

I've already wasted many hours on this. I have read and tried all suggestions that I can find online. Please help!
creator: larry9850

title: Add Security Exception window blocking the download of my emails
content: I have spoken to my ISP and its confirmed, as have I, that I can log on to its website and successfully download my emails so the problem "must" lie with Thunderbird. I am not very technically inclined so would appreciate some advice please, thank you. My ISP technical person (at iiNet Australia) did say they were receiving a lot of phone calls today about email and "blamed" it on changes to Outlook? If this helps. Regards.
creator: becbecbec

title: Background Color / Background Image does not load in Gmail web app
content:

So far, all the text formatting and colors work fine, but I cannot get the background color, or a background image, to register on gmail.

It appears that the background works when I load the message in the thunderbird client. It just doesn't show up in gmail web app.

Is there any workaround for this?

Thanks so much.

title: TB 115 add-ons
content:
TB 115 has a lot to like - so much that I immediately added another contribution. Then I noticed that there was no HTML tab in the composition window, so no chance to fix broken HTML (from copied source).

I'm pretty sure that facility was not native, but came from the ThunderHTMLedit add-on -- but there seem to be NO add-ons. So I came looking for "115 add-ons", and the first hit is the [| TB 115 FAQ] -- but it says nothing about add-ons!

IAC, a search for ThunderHTMLedit returns nothing, so that great add-on may be gone anyway, but what is happening with TB 115 and add-ons generally (and why does "115 add-ons" get a hit on the FAQ when the FAQ is silent on add-ons)?

[As much as I like TB 115, this may send me back to 102.]
creator: kaufmann
